The closest airport to Kingston T.F. Greene airport to the north in Warwick RI. This major airport is the main air travel hub in Rhode Island. It's located about 45 minutes away from Kingston by car, and taxicabs are available.
Route 138 runs east and west through the heart of Kingston Rhode Island. But you can also use route 2 (also known as the

Kingston train station has affordable fares and regularly scheduled departures/arrivals. Located in west Kington, the train station is small and easy to navigate. Also the station has a small museum open during operating hours.

RIPTA has a route that runs through Kingston, making stops at the train station in Kingston, the University of Rhode Island and others. Bus number 66 will take you to these places as well as to Galilee for a fee of $2.00.

value: ) is a cheap and efficient way to bus around Kingston, Rhode Island. Offering services from the train station to all around URI campus, the bus was originally meant for students but it is open to the general public for the fee of $1.00.
content=Open for anyone to walk around and explore the trails of colorful azaleas and rhododendrons. They typically blossom mid-May and stay open until the beginning of July.

content=Built in 1792, the Old Washington County Jail features changing exhibits which depict life in South County over the last 300 years.  Other attractions include period appropriate jail cells and rooms in which the former jailer's family and prisoners lived side by side.  The jailhouse is also the home of the Pettaquamscutt Historical Society.
401-783-2195. W-Su 1PM-5PM. Founded in 1929, the Helme House exhibits local artists and students.

content=URI's Kingston campus has a wonderful atmosphere. If you're interested in having a picnic, don't hesitate to have it in the quadrangle. The Botanical Gardens are open to the public and free at all times and showcase environmental landscape plants and practices.
content=Free of charge. Showing home gardens and landscapings.
content=URI Campus. Open to the public from 10AM-1:50PM. Check out the calendar for other events which might be going on in the arena.
directions=near the CVS in the Kingston Emporium
hours=open every day. Wednesdays are walk-in.
content=Tattoo parlor frequented by college students. Very clean and professional atmosphere.
address=50 Lower College Rd. Kingston, RI

content=The 193 Degree Coffeehouse is a student run coffee house located on the 2nd floor of the Memorial Union building at the University of Rhode Island. This coffee house has a large range of drinks, from bottled beverages to specialty hot chocolates. As well as serving inexpensive, organic, and fair trade coffee, this coffee house also hosts small concerts and open mics. The acts range from hip-hop, to indie, to psychedelic, to hardcore. Concerts are usually a sliding scale from $1-$5, given as gas money to touring bands.

content=The only hookah bar around, which is conveniently located in the emporium at URI. Students and locals come to enjoy the variety of flavors of tobacco and food. Very relaxing atmosphere - equipped with couches, and lounge chairs. This is the place to go with a group of friends looking to enjoy a night of hookah.
401-874-2627. Live theatre productions, Concert Choir and University Chorus performances, student recitals, the music department's semesterly Opera, and occasional non-URI performances.

content=Dates differ year to year, but is always held in August lasting from a Friday to Sunday. Hot air balloons from around the state are brought and take off in the late afternoon. There are small carnival rides, booths with jewelry, arts and small vendor's products and performances throughout the day.

content=Tanning salon located right in the URI Emporium. Offers different level state of the art beds and spray tans. Has both stand up and lay down beds available. Friendly and reliable service. Check the website for special offers and coupons.

The market is outdoors from May to October, rain or shine. The Saturday outdoor market is located at The University of Rhode Island's East Farm on Route 108 in Wakefield from 8:30AM to 12PM. The Tuesday outdoor market is located at Marina Park on Salt Pond Road in Wakefield from 2PM to 6PM. From November to April the market is indoors at Peace Dale Mills, 1425 Kingstown Road, Wakefield from 10AM to 2PM.

content=Great store to find URI apparel! Not only do they offer awesome sweatshirts, t-shirt's, sweat pants, and other hoodies, but also they have a customizing section of the store. University Spirit is very well known for its personal designs on sweat gear; they are especially popular with Greek Life at URI.
content=Offering breakfast, lunch, and dinner specials all day with delivery available. Albies is famous for their burgers, sandwiches, wraps, and fries. Caters to many URI students living on campus.
content=A cozy cafe and deli nestled in the heart of the URI Emporium. They offer a wide range of bagels and coffee. This cafe caters mainly to URI students and faculty.
content=Serving up American classics, including burgers, fries, shakes, and assorted salads. Reasonably priced meals and comfortable atmosphere for a quick bite to eat when your on-the-go.

content=Specialty in many types of calzones and strombolis. They also offer soda and ice cream. Delivery takes up to 45 minutes but rarely longer.  Make sure to have them repeat your order back. The food is reasonably priced for the large portions they offer.

content=Japanese food restaurant in the Emporium on URI campus. Very reasonable lunch specials and dinner combinations. They also offer a wide range of sushi and sashimi. Never takes more than 15 minutes for pick up orders.
content= As any typical Dunkin Donuts around the world, they offer Bagels, Breakfast sandwiches, and coffee for the student on the go. Very reasonably priced and great service.

content=Offering fabulous breakfast, lunch, and dinner specialties. Famous for their variety of panini's and omelets. They also offer salads, burgers, sandwiches, and more. A little pricier than other restaurants in the emporium, but well worth the money.

content=Offering unique Indian flavor to the URI emporium! Varanasi's menu includes Indian style chicken dinners and spicy rices. They also serve Curried dinners of many varieties. Also a great place if your looking for a vegetarian meal.

content=Looking for a Mediterranean lunch or dinner? International Steakhouse is home to amazing Kabob plates and falafel pockets. They specialize in gyros and veggie sandwiches. Large plates for a decent price, worth the visit.

content=Pizza by the slice, or personalized pies. International Pizza offers a wide variety of toppings and sides. Menu also includes hot & cold subs, salads, soups, pasta, and more. Plain cheese slice is only 1.99.
content=Located in the URI Memorial Union, Ronzio's caters to many students and faculty on campus. Offering Pizza, subs, calzones, salads, and pasta's.  Great option for delivery on campus.
content=This is a trendy restaurant in a very casual, family oriented atmosphere. Half of appetizers everyday between 4-6PM Price ranges are from $12-20.
content=Located in the University of Rhode Island's Memorial Union, it holds a wide variety burgers, sandwiches, salads, pizza, and snacks and serves breakfast all day. Prices range from $2-7.
content=This new location in Kingston offers over 200 fresh toppings, as homemade sauces range from Raspberry Mustard to Garlic Mayonnaise. There is free delivery within a 5 mile radius.

content=Some of the best Mexican food near URI ranging from regular taco's to quesadilla's.  The prices are very fair for the amount of food that you get.  Plenty of flavor in every bite for your mouth.  Every dish is made to your liking, mild to spicy.

content=There are no major hotels/motels directly in Kingston. However, there are many just five minutes away in South Kingstown and Narragansett. The Closest hotel to the town of Kingston would be the Holiday Inn. Excellent location (distance to local beaches and historic Newport.)

, 2605 Kingstown Rd, Kingston (On Route 138) ☎ +1 401 783-8254. It was previously a county court house; it also served as one of the five original state houses. The hours vary and change depending on holidays.  There is a decent selection of books, though it is not as large as the Peace Dale Library, there are also some movies and music.
